thread.title: 7 Ways To Eat A Little Healthier This Week
thread.title_full: 7 Ways To Eat A Little Healthier This Week

author: Melissa Harrison
title: 7 Ways To Eat A Little Healthier This Week
text:
View this image › 
buzzfeed.com They’re also perfect if you’re observing lent.
More: 20 Protein-Packed Dinners With No Meat 
ID: 10721907 2. Or try these vegan ones: View this image › 
buzzfeed.com Even if you’re not meat and dairy-free, these are great for anyone who might want to try something new in the kitchen. Find tons of ideas here .
More: 25 Weeknight Dinner Recipes With No Meat Or Dairy 
ID: 10721875 3. Cook a big batch of grains early on — like quinoa or farro — then incorporate them into meals throughout the week. Loading View on Instagram 
instagram.com Three cheers for meals that are already halfway made. This breakfast hash is farro + butternut squash + purple potatoes — all sautéed in olive oil and paprika. On top? A poached egg for extra protein.
ID: 10721800 4. While you’re at it, do the same thing with sheet pan roasted vegetables. ourbestbites.com 
  Just prep, store, and use as a heat-and-eat option throughout the week. Find the recipe for roasted brussels sprouts, butternut squash, and sausage here .
More: 19 Easy Single-Person Cooking Ideas That Won’t Waste Food Or Get Boring 
ID: 10722206 5. Need more fiber in your diet? Save this cheat sheet. View this image › 
buzzfeed.com And find even more cheat sheets on everything from meal prepping to marinades here .
More: 20 Cheat Sheets For When You’re Trying To Eat A Little Healthier 
ID: 10721930 6. On noodles or zoodles, swap out canned tomato sauce for homemade roasted red pepper sauce. pinchofyum.com 
  Red peppers are loaded with vitamin C, and making the sauce from scratch lets you ditch the added sugar and preservatives that can pop up in certain canned sauces. Find the recipe for these red pepper pasta zoodles here . 
More : 22 Tasty Ways To Hide Veggies In Your Favorite Foods 
ID: 10722110 7. For a sweet (and seasonal!) snack, try broiled grapefruit with a bit of brown sugar or honey. View this image › 
therusticwillow.com Equal parts sweet and tart. Find the instructions here , and find a full list of what’s in season this month here .
More: 31 Delicious Things To Cook In March 
ID: 10722317 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
